intro: Bupleurum ajanense subsp. purpureum, commonly known as the purple bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
